alert.note: Alert for Weld (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 17 at 7:49PM MDT until June 19 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Colorado... South Platte River near Balzac affecting Logan, Morgan and Washington Counties. South Platte River at Atwood affecting Logan County. South Platte River at Fort Morgan affecting Morgan County. South Platte River near Weldona affecting Weld and Morgan Counties. South Platte River near Kersey affecting Weld County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...South Platte River near Kersey. * WHEN...Until Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, The river is out of its banks and into fields and meadows. At 10.0 feet, Considerable lowland and meadow flooding occurs. This level represents a flood that has a 10-percent chance of being equaled or exceeded in any given year. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM MDT Saturday, the stage was 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise and crest near 9.3 feet by early Sunday morning. The river will then slowly recede through Monday. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
